           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1337806: Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543

      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<span class="line"><!---->In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<!----></span><br><br>    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::MaxQueueSize() const {<span class="line"><!---->    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::MaxQueueSize() const {<!----></span><br>      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<span class="line"><!---->      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<!----></span><br>      return queue ? queue->MaxSize() : 0;<span class="line"><!---->      return queue ? queue-&gt;MaxSize() : 0;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    template <typename NativeFrameType><span class="line"><!---->    template &lt;typename NativeFrameType&gt;<!----></span><br>    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close() {<span class="line"><!---->    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close() {<!----></span><br>      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_->RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<span class="line"><!---->      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_-&gt;RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<!----></span><br>      if (is_closed_)<span class="line"><!---->      if (is_closed_)<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>      is_closed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->      is_closed_ = true;<!----></span><br>      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<!----></span><br>        StopFrameDelivery();<span class="line"><!---->        StopFrameDelivery();<!----></span><br>        CloseController();<span class="line"><!---->        CloseController();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>      bool should_clear_queue = true;<span class="line"><!---->      bool should_clear_queue = true;<!----></span><br>      {<span class="line"><!---->      {<!----></span><br>        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<span class="line"><!---->        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<!----></span><br>        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<span class="line"><!---->        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<!----></span><br>        if (transferred_source_) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (transferred_source_) {<!----></span><br>          PostCrossThreadTask(<span class="line"><!---->          PostCrossThreadTask(<!----></span><br>              *transferred_source_->GetRealmRunner(), FROM_HERE,        <----<span class="line"><!---->              *transferred_source_-&gt;GetRealmRunner(), FROM_HERE,        &lt;----<!----></span><br>              CrossThreadBindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->              CrossThreadBindOnce(<!----></span><br>                  &FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close,<span class="line"><!---->                  &amp;FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close,<!----></span><br>                  WrapCrossThreadWeakPersistent(transferred_source_.Get())));<span class="line"><!---->                  WrapCrossThreadWeakPersistent(transferred_source_.Get())));<!----></span><br>          // The queue will be cleared by |transferred_source_|.<span class="line"><!---->          // The queue will be cleared by |transferred_source_|.<!----></span><br>          should_clear_queue = false;<span class="line"><!---->          should_clear_queue = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        transferred_source_.Clear();<span class="line"><!---->        transferred_source_.Clear();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<span class="line"><!---->transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<!----></span><br><br>When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_->GetRealmRunner() will be called.<span class="line"><!---->When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_-&gt;GetRealmRunner() will be called.<!----></span><br><br>scoped_refptr<base::SequencedTaskRunner> GetRealmRunner() {<span class="line"><!---->scoped_refptr&lt;base::SequencedTaskRunner&gt; GetRealmRunner() {<!----></span><br>  return realm_task_runner_;<span class="line"><!---->  return realm_task_runner_;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>    POC command line: chrome.exe --no-sandbox --incognito C:\poc\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    POC command line: chrome.exe --no-sandbox --incognito C:\poc\poc.html<!----></span><br>    (POC code sometimes take 5-20 minutes to trigger, tested on Windows)<span class="line"><!---->    (POC code sometimes take 5-20 minutes to trigger, tested on Windows)<!----></span><br><br>Limited ASAN info:<span class="line"><!---->Limited ASAN info:<!----></span><br><br>    ================================================================<span class="line"><!---->    ================================================================<!----></span><br>    ==23632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000000000040 (pc 0x7ff742822277 bp 0x00830fcfdd60 sp 0x00830fcfdce0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->    ==23632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000000000040 (pc 0x7ff742822277 bp 0x00830fcfdd60 sp 0x00830fcfdce0 T0)<!----></span><br>    ==23632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span         Re c#4: It's <span class="line"><!---->Re c#4: It's <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->https://crbug.com/1323488<!----></a>. I've cc'ed you on that bug.<span class="line"><!---->. I've cc'ed you on that bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

      </form>

    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>
      
    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

            star_border
          </i>

          <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">
            star_border
          </i>
        
      </button>

        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<span class="line"><!---->In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<!----></span><br><br>    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::MaxQueueSize() const {<span class="line"><!---->    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::MaxQueueSize() const {<!----></span><br>      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<span class="line"><!---->      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<!----></span><br>      return queue ? queue->MaxSize() : 0;<span class="line"><!---->      return queue ? queue-&gt;MaxSize() : 0;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    template <typename NativeFrameType><span class="line"><!---->    template &lt;typename NativeFrameType&gt;<!----></span><br>    void            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          </button>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>

      <option value="0" selected="">

      <div class="select-container">

        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<span class="line"><!---->In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<!----></span><br><br>    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::MaxQueueSize() const {<span class="line"><!---->    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::MaxQueueSize() const {<!----></span><br>      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<span class="line"><!---->      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<!----></span><br>      return queue ? queue->MaxSize() : 0;<span class="line"><!---->      return queue ? queue-&gt;MaxSize() : 0;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    template <typename NativeFrameType><span class="line"><!---->    template &lt;typename NativeFrameType&gt;<!----></span><br>    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close() {<span class="line"><!---->    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close() {<!----></span><br>      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_->RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<span class="line"><!---->      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_-&gt;RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<!----></span><br>      if (is_closed_)<span class="line"><!---->      if (is_closed_)<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>      is_closed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->      is_closed_ = true;<!----></span><br>      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<!----></span><br>        StopFrameDelivery();<span class="line"><!---->        StopFrameDelivery();<!----></span><br>        CloseController();<span class="line"><!---->        CloseController();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>      bool should_clear_queue = true;<span class="line"><!---->      bool should_clear_queue = true;<!----></span><br>      {<span class="line"><!---->      {<!----></span><br>        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<span class="line"><!---->        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<!----></span><br>        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<span class="line"><!---->        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<!----></span><br>        if (transferred_source_) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (transferred_source_) {<!----></span><br>          PostCrossThreadTask(<span class="line"><!---->             Issue 1337806: Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1337806: Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      vulnd...@sourcefire.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3950007980" title="vulnd...@sourcefire.com"><!---->vulnd...@sourcefire.com<!----></a>
      vulnd...@sourcefire.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->vulnd...@sourcefire.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 11:24 AM EDT

        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by vulnd...@sourcefire.com (Jun 20, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In             Issue 1337806: Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1337806: Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      vulnd...@sourcefire.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3950007980" title="vulnd...@sourcefire.com"><!---->vulnd...@sourcefire.com<!----></a>

      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 11:24 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 11:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">

            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
