      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<span class="line"><!---->In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<!----></span><br><br>    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::MaxQueueSize() const {<span class="line"><!---->    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::MaxQueueSize() const {<!----></span><br>      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<span class="line"><!---->      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<!----></span><br>      return queue ? queue->MaxSize() : 0;<span class="line"><!---->      return queue ? queue-&gt;MaxSize() : 0;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    template <typename NativeFrameType><span class="line"><!---->    template &lt;typename NativeFrameType&gt;<!----></span><br>    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close() {<span class="line"><!---->    void FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close() {<!----></span><br>      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_->RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<span class="line"><!---->      DCHECK(realm_task_runner_-&gt;RunsTasksInCurrentSequence());<!----></span><br>      if (is_closed_)<span class="line"><!---->      if (is_closed_)<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>      is_closed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->      is_closed_ = true;<!----></span><br>      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (GetExecutionContext()) {<!----></span><br>        StopFrameDelivery();<span class="line"><!---->        StopFrameDelivery();<!----></span><br>        CloseController();<span class="line"><!---->        CloseController();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>      bool should_clear_queue = true;<span class="line"><!---->      bool should_clear_queue = true;<!----></span><br>      {<span class="line"><!---->      {<!----></span><br>        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<span class="line"><!---->        MutexLocker locker(mutex_);<!----></span><br>        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<span class="line"><!---->        num_pending_pulls_ = 0;<!----></span><br>        if (transferred_source_) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (transferred_source_) {<!----></span><br>          PostCrossThreadTask(<span class="line"><!---->          PostCrossThreadTask(<!----></span><br>              *transferred_source_->GetRealmRunner(), FROM_HERE,        <----<span class="line"><!---->              *transferred_source_-&gt;GetRealmRunner(), FROM_HERE,        &lt;----<!----></span><br>              CrossThreadBindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->              CrossThreadBindOnce(<!----></span><br>                  &FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close,<span class="line"><!---->                  &amp;FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close,<!----></span><br>                  WrapCrossThreadWeakPersistent(transferred_source_.Get())));<span class="line"><!---->                  WrapCrossThreadWeakPersistent(transferred_source_.Get())));<!----></span><br>          // The queue will be cleared by |transferred_source_|.<span class="line"><!---->          // The queue will be cleared by |transferred_source_|.<!----></span><br>          should_clear_queue = false;<span class="line"><!---->          should_clear_queue = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        transferred_source_.Clear();<span class="line"><!---->        transferred_source_.Clear();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<span class="line"><!---->transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<!----></span><br><br>When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_->GetRealmRunner() will be called.<span class="line"><!---->When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_-&gt;GetRealmRunner() will be called.<!----></span><br><br>scoped_refptr<base::SequencedTaskRunner> GetRealmRunner() {<span class="line"><!---->scoped_refptr&lt;base::SequencedTaskRunner&gt; GetRealmRunner() {<!----></span><br>  return realm_task_runner_;<span class="line"><!---->  return realm_task_runner_;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>    POC command line: chrome.exe --no-sandbox --incognito C:\poc\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    POC command line: chrome.exe --no-sandbox --incognito C:\poc\poc.html<!----></span><br>    (POC code sometimes take 5-20 minutes to trigger, tested on Windows)<span class="line"><!---->    (POC code sometimes take 5-20 minutes to trigger, tested on Windows)<!----></span><br><br>Limited ASAN info:<span class="line"><!---->Limited ASAN info:<!----></span><br><br> AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000000000040 (pc 0x7ff742822277 bp 0x00830fcfdd60 sp 0x00830fcfdce0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->    ==23632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000000000040 (pc 0x7ff742822277 bp 0x00830fcfdd60 sp 0x00830fcfdce0 T0)<!----></span><br>    ==23632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->    ==23632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>    ==23632==Hint: address points to the zero page.<span class="line"><!---->    ==23632==Hint: address points to the zero page.<!----></span><br>    ==23632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<span class="line"><!---->    ==23632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!       ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<span class="line"><!---->In src\third_party\blink\renderer\modules\breakout_box\frame_queue_underlying_source.cc:167:<!----></span><br><br>    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::MaxQueueSize() const {<span class="line"><!---->    wtf_size_t FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::MaxQueueSize() const {<!----></span><br>      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<span class="line"><!---->      auto queue = frame_queue_handle_.Queue();<!----></span><br>      return queue ? queue->MaxSize() : 0;<span class="line"><!---->      return queue ? queue-&gt;MaxSize() : 0;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    template <typename NativeFrameType><span class="line"><!---->    template &lt;typename NativeFrameType&gt;<!----></span><br>    void       transferred_source_.Clear();<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<span class="line"><!---->transferred_source_ is the source of the transferred stream (in another realm - Worker).<!----></span><br><br>When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource<NativeFrameType>::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_->GetRealmRunner() will be called.<span class="line"><!---->When the context is destroyed (this can be forced i.e. by using location.reload()), the video frame element is closed. Above function is executed (FrameQueueUnderlyingSource&lt;NativeFrameType&gt;::Close()). The problem happens when transferred_source_-&gt;GetRealmRunner() will be called.<!----></span><br><br>scoped_refptr<base::SequencedTaskRunner> GetRealmRunner() {<span realm_task_runner_;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->GetRealmRunner is trying to reference an object that was already cleared by a different thread, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>    POC command line: chrome.exe --no-sandbox --incognito C:\poc\poc.html<span         }
      </style>

      ### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br>A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability exists in the WebCodecs functionality of Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63 and 104.0.5112.0. A specially-crafted web page can lead to a NULL pointer dereference /  use-after-free. An attacker can visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>### Tested Versions<span class="line"><!---->### Tested Versions<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 104.0.5112.0.<!----></span><br><br>### Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->### Product URLs<!----></span><br>Chrome - [<span class="line"><!---->Chrome - [<!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/](https://www.google.com/chrome/)<!----></a><br><br>### CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->### CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br><br>### CWE<span class="line"><!---->### CWE<!----></span><br>CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<span class="line"><!---->CWE-476 - NULL Pointer Dereference<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser, developed by Google.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome supports many features including WebCodecs standard. The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to video frames and audio chunks. It can be used by applications or websites that require control of media processing.<!----></span><br><br>In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<span class="line"><!---->In the POC code MediaStreamTrackProcessor ReadableStream is passed to the dummy javascript worker, which only references the provided stream (frame).<!----></span><br><br>From the poc code:<span class="line"><!---->From the poc code:<!----></span><br><br>let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<span class="line"><!---->let stream        = src_cnv.captureStream(fps);<!----></span><br>const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<span class="line"><!---->const track       = stream.getVideoTracks()[0]<!----></span><br>media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<span class="line"><!---->media_processor   = new MediaStreamTrackProcessor(track);<!----></span><br>const reader      = media_processor.readable;<span class="line"><!---->const reader      = media_processor.readable;<!----></span><br>myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<span class="line"><!---->myWorker.postMessage({ frame_source : reader}, [reader]);<!----></span><br><br>The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->The postMessage() method of the Worker interface sends a message to the worker's inner scope. Thus making the frame available in the Worker's area. It essential for the bug to trigger.<!----></span><br><br>Problem happens in the following function:<span class="line"><!---->Problem happens in the following function:<!----></span><br><br>In            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
